Welcome to the new edition of IOC R Training!
This page contains all the essential details for the training.
Please bookmark this page for quick access.

## Calendar

- Starts from: the week of 3rd November 2025  
- Time slots: **9:00 am – 12:00 pm**
- Format: Hybrid -- with **weeks 1, 5 and 9 held in-persion** at InforBio office; all other sessions take place online.
- Provisional schedule:  

  | **Week**           | **Session**                                                   |
  |--------------------|---------------------------------------------------------------|
  | **Week 1 (in-person)** | Kickstart with R: Your Gateway to Data Science            |
  | Week 2             | Data Foundations: Vectors and Matrices                        |
  | Week 3             | More Complex Data Structures: Data Frames and Lists           |
  | Week 4             | Building Logic: Operators, Conditions and Functions           |
  | **Week 5 (in-person)** | Graphing with {`ggplot2`}  (Part 1)                       |
  | Week 6             | R-fresh: Revisiting the Essentials                            |
  | Week 7             | Tidy Up: Wrangling Data with {`dplyr`} and {`tidyr`}          |
  | Week 8 | Graphs Level Up: {`ggplot2`} (Part 2) & Custom Functions                  |
  | **Week 9 (in-person)** | Putting It All Together: Reproducible Analysis with Quarto|
  | Week 10            | Your project presentation                                     |


## Recommended Readings

- [R for Data Science](https://r4ds.hadley.nz){target='_blank'} by Hadley Wickham, Mine Çetinkaya-Rundel, and Garrett Grolemund.
- [Hands-On Programming with R](https://rstudio-education.github.io/hopr/){target='_blank'} by Garrett Grolemund 
- [ggplot2: Elegant Graphics for Data Analysis](https://ggplot2.tidyverse.org){target='_blank'} by Hadley Wickham 
- [YaRrr! The Pirate’s Guide to R](https://bookdown.org/ndphillips/YaRrr/){target='_blank'} by Nathaniel D. Phillips
- [CRAN R Documentation](https://cran.r-project.org/){target='_blank'}
